<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTOCURRENCY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/11/new-cryptocurrency-trading-platform-bullish-takes-decentralized-finance?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Feeling Bullish?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/11/new-cryptocurrency-trading-platform-bullish-takes-decentralized-finance" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Bullish cryptocurrency" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDQ5L2J1bGxpc2hfY3J5cHRvY3VycmVuY3kuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A new cryptocurrency exchange just arrived on the scene like a transfer student in a rom-com. Meet <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-11/thiel-backed-block-one-injects-10-billion-in-crypto-exchange?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bullish Global</a>, which will open later this year with $10 billion of crypto assets preloaded and ready to trade, including 164,000 bitcoins. It got its initial capital from Block.one, a blockchain software company backed by billionaire investor Peter Thiel.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bullish brings a new spin to the world of decentralized finance, or DeFi, a buzzword we refuse to let a single Morning Brew reader pretend to understand for one more moment.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The gist of DeFi: </strong>When you borrow money, trade stocks, or Apple Pay-purchase a coffee, a middleman—a bank or a brokerage—makes the transaction happen. Decentralized finance cuts out that third party by running everything on blockchains, meaning all transactions are <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/decentralized-finance-defi-5113835?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made directly</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In other words, it's the difference between uploading a video straight to YouTube and selling it to a TV network to air on cable. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bullish will run on Block.one's own blockchain to cut out the market makers, which traditionally execute a transaction and profit on the difference between the price you paid and how much they actually made the trade for, aka the "spread."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">DeFi's a hot space right now. The market <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/c982082b-c890-4880-b438-f8b3cae83a4b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ballooned</a> from about $15 billion at the start of the year to $65 billion currently, per JPMorgan. The opportunity to cash in on the DeFi boom is one reason Bullish could break away from the herd. The other reason's a bit simpler…</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Crypto is the new Snack Pack pudding</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Trading on big-time crypto exchanges surged from less than $100 billion in April 2020 to $1.7 trillion last month, per <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/630c225a-5b78-4eef-aecf-f5a4c95276d1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">data</a> from The Block Crypto. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Which means it's <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-10/wall-street-unleashes-old-tricks-in-2-5-trillion-crypto-jungle?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">drawing greater interest</a> away from traditional pockets of finance: "All the fun that used to be had 30 years ago in the commodity markets and is no longer fun—that fun is now in crypto," GSR Markets CEO Trey Griggs told Bloomberg. We even read a report that a Goldman Sachs managing director is quitting his day job after hitting the jackpot <a href="https://www.efinancialcareers.com/news/2021/05/goldman-sachs-london-md-dogecoin?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">trading dogecoin</a>.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/11/gas-shortages?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Gas Shortages Are Here
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Gasoline shortages" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDUxL2dhc29saW5lX3Nob3J0YWdlcy5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, gas stations in the Southeast faced shortages and <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/east-coast-drivers-make-run-on-gas-stations-following-colonial-pipeline-shutdown-11620748473?mod=hp_lead_pos7" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">long lines</a> (up to five hours) of worried drivers following a hack that caused the country's largest fuel pipeline to shut down. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The pipeline's operator, Colonial, has so far restarted only minor sections of the system and won't restore it fully before the weekend. Even when the pipeline is operational again, it will take <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-11/n-y-must-wait-on-5-mph-gasoline-flow-once-pipeline-is-reopened?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nearly 15 days</a> for gasoline to get from a Houston refining hub up to New York Harbor, where fuel-guzzling hubs, such as airports, are desperately waiting.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Gas prices are at their highest level since 2014, per AAA.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F05%2F11%2Fgas-shortages" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/11/youtube-shorts-sets-100m-creators-fund?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tech Company, Creator Company...What's the Difference?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To support its short-form video product, Shorts, YouTube is <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/5/11/22429350/youtube-shorts-fund-video-payments-tiktok-competitor?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">setting up</a> a $100 million fund to lure creators away from other platforms, such as TikTok. OK, mostly from TikTok. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Shorts?</strong> In March, YouTube followed up Instagram’s Reels and Snapchat’s Spotlight with its own social-video platform to try and replicate TikTok's success. As of late April, Shorts was collecting 6.5 billion daily views.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>YouTube will offer monthly payments to creators with the most engagement while it works on a longer-term monetization plan for people supplying popular videos. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The company estimates thousands of creators will get paid monthly in the US and India, the two countries where Shorts is live.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It's an arms race for content</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Since launching last November, Snapchat's Spotlight has <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/20/snapchat-paying-1-million-a-day-to-video-creators.html?utm_source=morning_brew#:~:text=Snapchat%20is%20paying%20%241%20million,and%20some%20are%20getting%20rich&text=Snapchat%20introduced%20Spotlight%2C%20its%20TikTok,from%20a%20%241%20million%20pool." target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">handed out</a> $1 million per day to top creators. And TikTok recently expanded its fund for US creators to $1 billion over three years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Social platforms are dangling huge checks as they fight for your glazed-over eyeballs.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Deep within Casablanca—the real place, not the movie—there is a compelling chasm containing a cache of curios worth countless cash.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But to get there, you first have to get off the couch you’ve been inhabiting since early last year. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In just one tasty scoop, you get <strong style="color:#000">75 vitamins, minerals, and whole food-sourced ingredients—including a multivitamin, multimineral, probiotic, greens superfood blend, and more</strong>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And if you need a boost as you're lowering yourself into the Chasm of Casablanca, know that you can easily bring <a href="https://athleticgreens.go2cloud.org/aff_c?offer_id=27&aff_id=1033&adv_unique1=partner&aff_sub=10ctoffer-nutrition&aff_sub2=publisher&aff_sub5=newsletter&aff_sub3=primary2_10ct_051221&aff_sub4=cac&adv_unique3=business" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Athletic Greens</a> and its immunity-boosting, digestive health-helping ingredients with you.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So now that you’re ready to get out there and have adventures, grab the Athletic Greens, and go.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/11/key-performance-indicators-may-12?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Hiring sign" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NjQ2L2hpcmluZ19zaWduLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Paul Weaver/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>In March, there were <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/us-job-openings-vault-record-high-march-2021-05-11/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more open jobs</a> in the US than in any month since record-keeping began in 2000, jumping 597,000 to 8.1 million total. It's sure to spark even more debate around the extra unemployment benefits the Biden administration extended through the summer.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> "It's got to be somewhere in the $80,000 to $90,000 range, if not higher."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That was NYC mayoral candidate Ray McGuire's <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/10/opinion/ray-mcguire-endorsement-interview.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">best guess</a> at the median sales price for a home or apartment in Brooklyn, when asked by the NYT editorial board. McGuire, a former Citi exec, was off by a factor of 10—it's more like $900,000. FWIW, fellow mayoral candidate Shaun Donovan, who was the <em>former Secretary of Housing and Urban Development,</em> guessed $100,000. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Your least favorite gross viral food videos are all connected to one guy. <td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EXPLAINER
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/11/reader-qa-inflation-bad-stocks?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Reader Q&A: Why Is Inflategate Tanking My Portfolio?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/11/reader-qa-inflation-bad-stocks" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A GIF of a balloon being inflated by a helium tank " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/zntF1aeUvEdKWUEEB8/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A GIF of a balloon being inflated by a helium tank " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/zntF1aeUvEdKWUEEB8/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Reader Q from Sarai in Alabama: </strong>Why is inflation considered bad for stocks?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew's A:</strong> Prices on everything from cereal to ride-hailing services are rising right now, and some investors are getting antsy about inflation, or the rate at which the prices of goods and services rise. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At its last reading in April, the consumer price index (CPI), an indicator of the cost for a "basket" of typical consumer goods and services, was up 2.6% over the preceding 12 months. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Federal Reserve has a goal of 2% <em>average</em> inflation—so it's okay if things run a little higher in the short-term. And Fed Chair Jerome Powell and Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen think the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/10/cheese-ubers-prices-rising?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recent bump</a> in consumer prices is temporary.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Investors aren't so sure. </strong>"Rising commodity prices, labor constraints, supply chain disruptions, and more fiscal stimulus potentially in the pipeline are a cocktail for faster price growth in the economy," Barron's <a href="https://www.barrons.com/articles/u-s-tech-selloff-set-to-continue-as-european-and-asian-stocks-tumble-51620727901?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If inflation keeps creeping up, some investors worry, the Fed may relax some of its pandemic-era stimulus measures, which have kept borrowing costs low and generally been very good for businesses. That could include raising interest rates or reducing its $120 billion/month bond-buying program. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>at 8:30am ET, the latest CPI reading drops. <a href="https://www.bls.gov/cpi/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check it out for yourself</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ For more market basics, </strong><a href="https://vm.tiktok.com/ZMeg5E7BV/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here's what it means</a> to own a stock.</p>

Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA new cryptocurrency exchange just arrived on the scene like a transfer student in a rom-com. Meet \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-11/thiel-backed-block-one-injects-10-billion-in-crypto-exchange?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBullish Global\u003c/a\u003e, which will open later this year with $10 billion of crypto assets preloaded and ready to trade, including 164,000 bitcoins. It got its initial capital from Block.one, a blockchain software company backed by billionaire investor Peter Thiel.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBullish brings a new spin to the world of decentralized finance, or DeFi, a buzzword we refuse to let a single Morning Brew reader pretend to understand for one more moment.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe gist of DeFi: \u003c/strong\u003eWhen you borrow money, trade stocks, or Apple Pay-purchase a coffee, a middleman—a bank or a brokerage—makes the transaction happen. Decentralized finance cuts out that third party by running everything on blockchains, meaning all transactions are \u003ca href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/decentralized-finance-defi-5113835?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emade directly\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn other words, it's the difference between uploading a video straight to YouTube and selling it to a TV network to air on cable. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBullish will run on Block.one's own blockchain to cut out the market makers, which traditionally execute a transaction and profit on the difference between the price you paid and how much they actually made the trade for, aka the \"spread.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDeFi's a hot space right now. The market \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/c982082b-c890-4880-b438-f8b3cae83a4b?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eballooned\u003c/a\u003e from about $15 billion at the start of the year to $65 billion currently, per JPMorgan. The opportunity to cash in on the DeFi boom is one reason Bullish could break away from the herd. style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo support its short-form video product, Shorts, YouTube is \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/5/11/22429350/youtube-shorts-fund-video-payments-tiktok-competitor?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esetting up\u003c/a\u003e a $100 million fund to lure creators away from other platforms, such as TikTok. OK, mostly from TikTok. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eShorts?\u003c/strong\u003e In March, YouTube followed up Instagram’s Reels and Snapchat’s Spotlight with its own social-video platform to try and replicate TikTok's success. As of late April, Shorts was collecting 6.5 billion daily views.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYouTube will offer monthly payments to creators with the most engagement while it works on a longer-term monetization plan for people supplying popular videos. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe company estimates thousands of creators will get paid monthly in the US and India, the two countries where Shorts is live.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt's an arms race for content\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSince launching last November, Snapchat's Spotlight has \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/20/snapchat-paying-1-million-a-day-to-video-creators.html?utm_source=morning_brew#:~:text=Snapchat%20is%20paying%20%241%20million,and%20some%20are%20getting%20rich\u0026text=Snapchat%20introduced%20Spotlight%2C%20its%20TikTok,from%20a%20%241%20million%20pool.\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehanded out\u003c/a\u003e $1 million per day to top creators. And TikTok recently expanded its fund for US creators to $1 billion over three years.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Social platforms are dangling huge checks as they fight for your glazed-over eyeballs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReader Q from Sarai in Alabama: \u003c/strong\u003eWhy is inflation considered bad for stocks?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBrew's A:\u003c/strong\u003e Prices on everything from cereal to ride-hailing services are rising right now, and some investors are getting antsy about inflation, or the rate at which the prices of goods and services rise. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt its last reading in April, the consumer price index (CPI), an indicator of the cost for a \"basket\" of typical consumer goods and services, was up 2.6% over the preceding 12 months. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Federal Reserve has a goal of 2% \u003cem\u003eaverage\u003c/em\u003e inflation—so it's okay if things run a little higher in the short-term. And Fed Chair Jerome Powell and Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen think the \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/10/cheese-ubers-prices-rising?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecent bump\u003c/a\u003e in consumer prices is temporary.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eInvestors aren't so sure. \u003c/strong\u003e\"Rising commodity prices, labor constraints, supply chain disruptions, and more fiscal stimulus potentially in the pipeline are a cocktail for faster price growth in the economy,\" Barron's \u003ca href=\"https://www.barrons.com/articles/u-s-tech-selloff-set-to-continue-as-european-and-asian-stocks-tumble-51620727901?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf inflation keeps creeping up, some investors worry, the Fed may relax some of its pandemic-era stimulus measures, which have kept borrowing costs low and generally been very good for businesses. That could include raising interest rates or reducing its $120 billion/month bond-buying program. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong
